description._content: TITLE Joslin House, Keene NH CREATOR SUBJECT Houses - NH - Keene Homes - NH - Keene DESCRIPTION Photo of the residence of C.E. Joslin, Court Street, Keene New Hampshire. In 1889, Charles E. Joslin bought from Horatio G. Parker of Boston the Old Parker Place at 150 Court St. He razed the old house, which had been built in the early 1800s by Luther Smith, clockmaker, and erected a "thoroughly modern and elegant" Victorian house on the site. The architect was Frank Smith of Boston and the builder was Cassius M. White of Keene.There are 14 rooms, including four bedrooms. Joslin and his wife, Julia Ann Manning had one son. Charles was treasurer of the Cheshire Chair Company. Joslin's son Edward sold the property to Frederic A. Faulkner in 1909. It was later the home of Philip H. Faulkner and after 1948, the David F. Putnams. The earlier house on the site was the Parker House, owned by Elijah Parker. PUBLISHER Keene Public Library DATE DIGITAL 20071108 DATE ORIGINAL RESOURCE TYPE photographs FORMAT image/jpg RESOURCE IDENTIFIER hsykhse045 RIGHTS MANAGMENT No known restriction on publication.
